articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian Figure
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian Figure 
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Yehia Jakariya Khairallah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, on the occasion of the February holiday.
 It was conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Egypt by the chairman of the Egyptian committee on Feb. 18.    
 The chairman said that he had the honor of presenting the gift to Kim Jong Il, the most respected leader, on the significant February holiday. He sincerely wished for the good health of the leader clearly indicating the road for the Korean people and other progressive people of the world to follow with his Songun politics.

Greetings to Bulgarian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian President
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Georgi Parvanov, president of Bulgaria, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished Bulgaria new progress and prosperity and expressed the belief that the traditional relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

New Stamps on Agrarian Reform Law Off Press
articles.content:
New Stamps on Agrarian Reform Law Off Press
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The Korea Stamp Corporation has recently issued a souvenir sheet and an individual stamp on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the promulgation of the historic "Law on Agrarian Reform in North Korea" by President Kim Il Sung on March 5, Juche 35 (1946).
 Printed on the stamps are the words "In Commemoration of 60th anniversary of the promulgation of the Agrarian Reform Law" and "Juche 35 (1946) - Juche 95 (2006)".
 The souvenir sheet gives an image of the President conversing with the model peasant who initiated the patriotic rice donation movement along with a picture of peasants hailing the law with the placards bearing the slogans "Land to the tillers!" and "Long Live Agrarian Reform Law" in their hands.    
 The individual stamp reflects the words "Promulgation of Historic Agrarian Reform Law on March 5, Juche 35 (1946)" and pictures of peasants shedding tears of joy and gratitude over the land distribution and cooperative fields which have been rezoned to be fit for the land of the socialist Korea under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
 Their face values are 150 won and 12 won respectively.

articles.title: Greetings to Bulgarian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Sergei Stanishev, prime minister of Bulgaria,  on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in an all-round way in the bilateral interests and wished the Bulgarian people wellbeing.

articles.title: Credentials Presented to FM
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to FM
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun today received credentials from Representative of the WHO here Tej Walia.
 After receiving the credentials, Paek had a talk with the representative.
